body_html:
Maybe supid question, but along which axis is the fft performed?
Assume a 3D tensor with 2D-images along the 3rd dimension, now I'm doing a fft2d. How would I do it if I want to do it for each 2D slice seperatly?

Most other libraries have something like np.fft2d(image, s=None, axes=2) or so.
Would be nice to have this feature also in TensorFlow :)

Would be nice to have this feature also in TensorFlow :)
body:
Maybe supid question, but along which axis is the fft performed? 
Assume a 3D tensor with 2D-images along the 3rd dimension, now I'm doing a fft2d. How would I do it if I want to do it for each 2D slice seperatly? 

Most other libraries have something like `np.fft2d(image, s=None, axes=2) `or so. 
Would be nice to have this feature also in TensorFlow :)
